issue.title: write client with typescript
issue.body:
fixes #16

## What

- adding a `.npmignore` file
- adding a prettier config file
- adding a `format` script that format `src/` and `tests/` directories thanks to prettier
- running prettier over all files
- adding a `build` script that compile `src/` into `build/` thanks to tsc
- create first types by retroengineering responses (`src/types/`)
- create first typescript version of the Tado class (`src/index.ts`)
- export the Tado class as a named class instead of using `default`
- settings the `types` entry into the `package.json`
- adding myself as contributor
- `updatePresence` use Promise.all


Note that I choose to push the build/ directory if some folks use the git repository as a dependency instead of npm.

## TODOs
- [x] Finish typing the client
- [x] Maybe publish the fork on my own to see how it behaves

@mattdavis90 I can't do more with available data right now.

As you may notice there is two methods I can't call without the Tado API rejecting me: 
- getEnergyIQTariff
- updateEnergyIQTariff

I added // FIXME: on top of them

There are some type I can't guess.

And finally I extracted enums in a dedicated file so this is easier if someone want to help by adding a value I can't catch.

---

Feel free to modify the PR if needed.
If you want me to try to publish this version in a new name I'll do.

comment.body:
Hello @mattdavis90 :) 

This is **almost** backward compatible at the moment, here is what break things RN:
> export the Tado class as a named class instead of using default

I did it for DX (developer experience) because as far as I know, this is a pain to handle default exports in all worlds (commonjs/esm/typescript/etc)
If you really want to let it as a default export I can revert this!

FYI I keep all your test to make sure the change I do are okay + I have a client to test each exposed method with my own Tado [and to retrieive payload to type them], sadly I don't have a AC.

Bump axios from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2

Bumps [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios) from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/axios/axios/releases)
- [Changelog](https://github.com/axios/axios/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
- [Commits](https://github.com/axios/axios/compare/v0.21.1...v0.21.2)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: axios
  dependency-type: direct:production
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>

Update README to fix login example

login example suggested we can retrieve token but this is not the case right now.

Merge pull request #23 from fabienjuif/patch-1

Update README to fix login example
add support for update energy tariff
add support for update energy tariff

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/feature/stats' into feature/stats

# Conflicts:

Bump axios from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2
updated readme.md and beter naming convention for energyIQ Tariff

Merge pull request #24 from fbenniks/feature/stats

Feature/stats
Adds HTTPS Agent with keep-alive enabled to Axios requests

Merge pull request #28 from andybee/http-keep-alive

Adds HTTPS Agent with keep-alive enabled to Axios requests
Update Readme to incorporate multi overlay setting

- adding a `.npmignore` file

- running prettier over all files

- adding myself as contributor
- `updatePresence` use Promise.all


Note that I choose to push the build/ directory if some folks use the git repository as a dependency instead of npm.

- [x] Maybe publish the fork on my own to see how it behaves

comment.body:
Hello @mattdavis90 :) 

This is **almost** backward compatible at the moment, here is what break things RN:
> export the Tado class as a named class instead of using default

I did it for DX (developer experience) because as far as I know, this is a pain to handle default exports in all worlds (commonjs/esm/typescript/etc)
If you really want to let it as a default export I can revert this!

FYI I keep all your test to make sure the change I do are okay + I have a client to test each exposed method with my own Tado [and to retrieive payload to type them], sadly I don't have a AC.

updated-dependencies:

- adding a `format` script that format `src/` and `tests/` directories thanks to prettier
- running prettier over all files
- adding a `build` script that compile `src/` into `build/` thanks to tsc
- create first types by retroengineering responses (`src/types/`)
- create first typescript version of the Tado class (`src/index.ts`)
- export the Tado class as a named class instead of using `default`
- settings the `types` entry into the `package.json`
- adding myself as contributor
- `updatePresence` use Promise.all


Note that I choose to push the build/ directory if some folks use the git repository as a dependency instead of npm.

## TODOs
- [x] Finish typing the client
- [x] Maybe publish the fork on my own to see how it behaves

comment.body:
Hello @mattdavis90 :) 

This is **almost** backward compatible at the moment, here is what break things RN:
> export the Tado class as a named class instead of using default

I did it for DX (developer experience) because as far as I know, this is a pain to handle default exports in all worlds (commonjs/esm/typescript/etc)
If you really want to let it as a default export I can revert this!

FYI I keep all your test to make sure the change I do are okay + I have a client to test each exposed method with my own Tado [and to retrieive payload to type them], sadly I don't have a AC.

Bump axios from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2

Bumps [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios) from 0.21.1 to 0.21.2.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/axios/axios/releases)
- [Changelog](https://github.com/axios/axios/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
- [Commits](https://github.com/axios/axios/compare/v0.21.1...v0.21.2)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: axios
  dependency-type: direct:production
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>

Update README to fix login example

login example suggested we can retrieve token but this is not the case right now.

Update README to fix login example
add support for update energy tariff
add support for update energy tariff
